name: Stack Safari Workshop
purpose: Explore and select the technology stack through playful discovery and visual architecture design

facilitator_requirements.facilitation_notes: Balance fun exploration with practical decision-making. Celebrate diverse technical perspectives.

phases.name: Opening and Context
phases.description: Connect technology choices to vision and ethics
ai_prompts: Today we explore the technology that will bring your vision to life.
Remember: technology choices should serve your mission and honor your ethical boundaries.
Let's approach this with curiosity - the best stack emerges from honest exploration.

phases.name: Tech Speed Dating
phases.description: Rapid-fire exploration of technology options with structured evaluation
ai_prompts: Let's speed date some technologies! For each option, consider: Does it align with our values? Does it serve our stakeholders?
Technology: [Name]. In 2 minutes, share: What it does, why it might fit, and one concern.
Quick reaction: Thumbs up, thumbs down, or curious for more?

phases.name: Trade-Off Tetris Game
phases.description: Visualize and navigate competing constraints through spatial arrangement
activities: Identify all constraints (time, budget, skills, etc.)
Attempt to fit all blocks in container
ai_prompts: What are all the constraints on your technology choices? Let's make them visible.
This block doesn't fit. What are you willing to trade off?
What's truly non-negotiable in your configuration?

phases.name: Architecture Pictionary Game
phases.description: Surface mental models through visual communication
ai_prompts: Draw: The data flow when a user submits a request
Draw: How your agents will collaborate with the codebase
Compare: How did different people visualize [concept]?

phases.name: Blueprint Matching
phases.description: Match technology choices to available blueprints
ai_prompts: Based on your technology explorations, here are the blueprints that might fit:
Blueprint: [name]. Match level: [%]. Key alignments: [list]. Gaps: [list].
Which blueprint should we start with? What customizations do we need?

phases.name: Knowledge Sources Gathering
phases.description: Identify reference repositories, documentation, and domain knowledge that will power the agents
activities: Map code patterns to learn from
ai_prompts: What reference materials should your agents know about?
Are there GitHub repos with patterns you want agents to follow?
What documentation sites should agents reference?
What internal documents or wikis contain important knowledge?
What domain-specific concepts must agents understand?

phases.name: Stack Questionnaire
phases.description: Capture individual technology preferences and concerns

phases.name: Closing and Preview
phases.description: Synthesize stack decisions, preview Agent Assembly
ai_prompts: Here's your technology stack configuration based on today's exploration.
This will be built on the [blueprint] blueprint with these customizations.
Next time, we design the agents that will support your development in the Agent Assembly!

questions.question: What is your primary programming language?
On a scale of 1-10, how confident are you in the stack we've chosen?
What technology concern do we need to address?
What's the biggest technical risk with our chosen stack?
List any GitHub repositories that contain patterns or examples your agents should learn from (one per line):
List documentation sites or API references that should be accessible to agents:
What internal documents (Confluence, wikis, ADRs) contain important project knowledge?
What domain-specific concepts or terminology must agents understand?
Are there any websites or online resources that are essential references for your domain?

discussion_formats.name: Technology Showcase
discussion_formats.description: Team members with experience share insights on specific technologies
discussion_formats.when_to_use: When team has diverse technical backgrounds
discussion_formats.facilitation_guide: 3 minutes per person to share experience with a technology, then Q&A

discussion_formats.name: Constraint Negotiation
discussion_formats.when_to_use: During Trade-Off Tetris when blocks don't fit
discussion_formats.facilitation_guide: Identify conflicting constraints, each stakeholder advocates, find creative solutions

success_indicators: Blueprint is selected with clear customizations
Knowledge sources are cataloged for agent use

axiom_zero_integration.opening_ritual: Acknowledge that technology serves people - our choices should reflect love for our users
axiom_zero_integration.closing_ritual: Appreciate the diverse technical perspectives each team member brought
love_and_trust_moments: Tech speed dating respects everyone's experience and opinions
Trade-off negotiations require trust to give and take
Architecture pictionary celebrates different mental models
